quotes.quote: Words are a pretext. It is the inner bond that draws one person to another, not words.

There is such a thing as crazy-mother bonding. . . . It happens when one realizes the other also has had a crazy mother, and it is both painful and pleasurable. There are more crazy mothers than you might think.
Bond is stronger than blood. The family grows stronger by bond.
A slip of the foot may injure your body, but a slip of the tongue will injure your bond.

What would it be like to feel so attached, so intrinsically bonded, so protective of one’s own best connection with time and the ages, of generations past and future, of another human life, of their time?
bonding through dependence never works, whereas bonding through freedom always does.
Accountability is the glue that bonds commitment to results.
There is very hard bonding between Tears and Rain, often both falls together in Happiness and in Pain
The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other’s life.
Nothing is more exciting and bonding in relationships than creating together.
Anybody with a good sense of humor is one-up on their competition. We respond to somebody who has the ability to make us laugh. It's a bonding influence.
Emotion brings in the dimension of bonding or tuning in: An experience that touches your heart makes the meaning that much more personal.
Music has a bonding power, it's primal social cement
The break down for kids is communication. Music helps bring that bond.
When you go through a tragedy with someone, the bond is stronger.
No better way to bond than food.
The principle of subordination is the great bond of union and harmony through the universe.

The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.

A loving family provides the foundation children need to succeed, and strong families with a man and a woman - bonded together for life - always have been, and always will be, the key to such families.

Finding things you enjoy doing together is critical to family bonding. And although watching TV or going to a movie together are fine activities, the problem with them is they are not really interactive.

The opportunity to experience the parent–child bond when a person may have otherwise thought that he or she would not be able to do so can be a wonderful and welcome benefit of becoming part of a blended family.
Strength alone does not create human bonds. The world is filled with more warmth than that.
